questions.q3: Do you have previous mountain hiking experience?
questions.q4: How do you feel about prolonged climbs and elevation changes?
questions.q5: How do you react to physical fatigue?

beginner.title: Beginner Level
beginner.description: Suitable for people who are active in their daily life, walk occasionally, can walk 3–4 hours a day on mostly stable terrain with little elevation change.
beginner.note: Even though it's beginner level, it's still mountain hiking and requires good physical and mental attitude.

intermediate.title: Intermediate Level
intermediate.description: Suitable for people who exercise regularly, can walk 5–7 hours a day, have previous hiking experience and feel comfortable with ups and downs on irregular terrain.
intermediate.note: This level is ideal for those who have done hiking and are looking for a moderate challenge.

advanced.title: Advanced Level
advanced.description: Suitable for people who train consistently, can walk 7–9 hours a day, have solid mountain experience and handle significant elevation changes on technical terrain well.
advanced.note: This level is for long routes with high physical and mental demands.

importantNote: All our tours require participants to be active people, have good mobility and be able to walk several hours.
encouragement: Our goal is not for you to choose the most difficult tour, but the one that best suits you so you can enjoy the experience safely and memorably
